commentBody: The replay itself is not ruining sports as we like to see fantastic plays in slow motion to marvel at the performance and at times outstanding skills. But now that sports have become just a ruthless and relentless corporate pursuit of money by all and any means necessary they are no longer sports. These NCAA and NFL executive miscreants have ruined the game of college and professional football. Money Ball is not a sport. Now, replays have become just another tool of contention, an excuse to overturn a play that has already taken place and in the aura of sportsmanship - bad calls happen at times, its all part of the original definition of the game - thus ruining the momentum of the game. If you can even call them games anymore.  Then there is the truly nauseating sponsorship which apparently you need these days to even blow your nose and use the remote. Click,
